entry.title: The Planning (Inquiry Procedure) Rules (Northern Ireland) 2006
entry.summary: Article 123(1) of the Planning (Northern Ireland) Order 1991 provides that the Department of the Environment (the Department) may cause a public local inquiry to be held for the purpose of the exercise of any of its functions under that Order and Article 123(2) provides that the Department may make rules to regulate the procedures to be followed in connection with inquiries held by or on behalf of the Department.

entry.title: The Sea Fishing (Restriction on Days at Sea) (Monitoring, Inspection and Surveillance) Order 2006
entry.summary: This Order provides for the administration and enforcement of the provisions of Annex IIA and IIC (“the Annexes”) to Council Regulation (EC) No 51/2006 (OJ No L16, 20.1.06, p1) fixing for 2006 the fishing opportunities and associated conditions for certain fish stocks and groups of fish stocks, applicable in Community waters and, for Community vessels, in waters where catch limitations are required (“the Regulation”).

entry.title: The Credit Unions (Maximum Interest Rate on Loans) Order 2006
entry.summary: This Order increases the limit on the interest which a credit union may charge on loans made by it. The maximum rate of interest is increased from 1% to 2% per month.

entry.title: The A249 Trunk Road (Iwade Bypass to Queenborough Improvement) (50 Miles per Hour Speed Limit) Order 2006
entry.summary: This version of the The A249 Trunk Road (Iwade Bypass to Queenborough Improvement) (50 Miles per Hour Speed Limit) Order 2006 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The A249 Trunk Road (Iwade Bypass to Queenborough Improvement) (Prohibition of Left and Right Hand Turns) Order 2006
entry.summary: This version of the The A249 Trunk Road (Iwade Bypass to Queenborough Improvement) (Prohibition of Left and Right Hand Turns) Order 2006 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The Planning (Listed Buildings, Conservation Areas and Hazardous Substances) (Amendment) (England) Regulations 2006
entry.summary: Section 83 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 (“the 2004 Act”) amended the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 by inserting a new section 82B. This makes provision for urgent applications for works to buildings on Crown land which are listed or which are in conservation areas and provides for such applications to be made directly to the Secretary of State. Section 82B(8) imposes a duty on the Secretary of State to publicise the application in accordance with any prescribed requirements. These Regulations amend the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Regulations 1990 to prescribe those publicity requirements (regulation 2).

entry.title: The Human Tissue (Scotland) Act 2006 (Commencement) Order 2006
entry.summary: This Order appoints dates for the coming into force of provisions of the Human Tissue (Scotland) Act 2006 (asp 4) (“the Act”). The Act received Royal Assent on 16th March 2006 and sections 52, 59, 60 and 62 came into force on that day.

entry.title: The Plant Protection Products (Amendment) Regulations 2006
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Plant Protection Products Regulations 2005 (S.I. 2005/1435) (“the Principal Regulations”) which implement in England and Wales Council Directive 91/414/EEC concerning the placing of plant protection products on the market (OJ No. L230, 19.8.91, p.1, as read with corrigenda published in OJ No. L170, 25.6.92, p.40).

entry.title: The Protection of Water Against Agricultural Nitrate Pollution (England and Wales) (Amendment) Regulations 2006
entry.summary: These Regulations make provision for implementing, in part, Article 2 of Directive 2003/35/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council on public participation in respect of drawing up certain plans and programmes relating to the environment (O.J. No. L156, 25.6.2003, p. 17). The programmes to which that Article applies include action programmes in relation to nitrate vulnerable zones designated under Council Directive 91/676/EEC concerning the protection of waters against pollution caused by nitrates from agricultural sources (O.J. No. L375, 31.12.91, p. 1).

entry.title: The A249 Trunk Road (Iwade Bypass to Queenborough Improvement) (Prohibition of Certain Classes of Traffic and Pedestrians) Order 2006
entry.summary: This version of the The A249 Trunk Road (Iwade Bypass to Queenborough Improvement) (Prohibition of Certain Classes of Traffic and Pedestrians) Order 2006 is published under the authority and superintendence of the Queen's Printer of Acts of Parliament and Controller of HMSO. It has been prepared to reflect the text as it was Made.

entry.title: The Common Agricultural Policy Single Payment and Support Schemes (Amendment) Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2006
entry.summary: These Regulations amend the Common Agricultural Policy Single Payment and Support Schemes Regulations (Northern Ireland) 2005 (S.R. 2005/256) (“the principal Regulations”).

title.div: The Anti-social Behaviour Act 2003 (Commencement No. 5) (Wales) Order 2006 / Gorchymyn Deddf Ymddygiad Gwrthgymdeithasol 2003 (Cychwyn Rhif 5) (Cymru) 2006

div.p: This Order brings into force in Wales on 11 May 2006 sections 19 to 22 and 24 of the Anti-social Behaviour Act 2003 (“the 2003 Act”), which concern parenting contracts and parenting orders for school pupils.

Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn dwyn i rym yng Nghymru ar 11 Mai 2006 adrannau 19 i 22 a 24 o Ddeddf Ymddygiad Gwrthgymdeithasol 2003 (“Deddf 2003”), sy'n ymwneud â chontractau rhianta a gorchmynion rhianta ar gyfer disgyblion ysgol.

title.div: The Education (Parenting Orders) (Wales) Regulations 2006 / Rheoliadau Addysg (Gorchmynion Rhianta) (Cymru) 2006

div.p: These Regulations prescribe the conditions to be met before a local education authority may apply to a magistrates' court for a parenting order under section 20(1)(b) of the Anti-social Behaviour Act 2003. The Regulations apply in relation to pupils excluded from schools in Wales.

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn rhagnodi'r amodau sydd i'w bodloni cyn y caiff awdurdod addysg lleol wneud cais i lys ynadon am orchymyn rhianta o dan adran 20(1)(b) o Ddeddf Ymddygiad Gwrthgymdeithasol 2003. Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn yn gymwys o ran disgyblion a waherddir o ysgolion yng Nghymru.

entry.title: The Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 (Commencement No. 9 and Consequential Provisions) Order 2006
entry.summary: Article 2 of this Order brings into force on 7th June 2006, in relation to England and Wales, the following provisions of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 (“the Act”)—

title.div: The Animal By-Products (Wales) Regulations 2006 / Rheoliadau Sgil-gynhyrchion Anifeiliaid (Cymru) 2006

div.p: These Regulations, which apply in relation to Wales, revoke and re-make the Animal By-Products Regulations 2003, which made provision in Wales for the administration and enforcement of Regulation (EC) No 1774/2002 of the European Parliament and of the Council laying down health rules concerning animal by-products not intended for human consumption (OJ No. L273, 10.10.2002, p1.) (“the Community Regulation”).

Mae'r Rheoliadau hyn, sy'n gymwys o ran Cymru, yn dirymu ac yn ail-wneud Rheoliadau Sgil-gynhyrchion Anifeiliaid 2003, y gwnaed darpariaeth ganddynt yng Nghymru ar gyfer gweinyddu a gorfodi Rheoliad (EC) Rhif 1774/2002 Senedd Ewrop a'r Cyngor sy'n gosod rheolau iechyd ynghylch sgil-gynhyrchion anifeiliaid na fwriedir i bobl eu bwyta (OJ Rhif L273, 10.10.2002, t.1) (“Rheoliad y Gymuned”).

entry.title: The Public Transport Users' Committee for Scotland Order 2006
entry.summary: This Order establishes the Public Transport Users' Committee for Scotland.

title.div: The Countryside and Rights of Way Act 2000 (Commencement No. 8 and Transitional Provisions) (Wales) Order 2006 / Gorchymyn Deddf Cefn Gwlad a Hawliau Tramwy 2000 (Cychwyn Rhif 8 a Darpariaethau Troisannol) (Cymru) 2006

div.p: This Order brings into force certain provisions of Part II of the Countryside and Rights of Way Act 2000 (“the 2000 Act”) on 11 May 2006 in relation to Wales.
Mae'r Gorchymyn hwn yn dwyn i rym ddarpariaethau penodol Rhan II o Ddeddf Cefn Gwlad a Hawliau Tramwy 2000 (“Deddf 2000”) ar 11 Mai 2006 o ran Cymru.

entry.title: The Town and Country Planning (Application of Subordinate Legislation to the Crown) Order 2006

ukm:Subject.Value: TOWN AND COUNTRY PLANNING, ENGLAND AND WALES

category.term: TOWN AND COUNTRY PLANNING, ENGLAND AND WALES
TOWN AND COUNTRY PLANNING, ENGLAND AND WALES

entry.summary: Part 7 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004 applies the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and the Planning (Hazardous Substances) Act 1990 to the Crown. As well as applying the planning Acts to the Crown, Part 7 makes provision for national security, urgent Crown development, enforcement, preservation of trees and old mining permissions.

entry.title: The Local Government (Boundaries) (Northern Ireland) Order 2006
entry.summary: This Order provides for there to be 7 local government districts in Northern Ireland. It also provides for the appointment of a Local Government Boundaries Commissioner to recommend the boundaries and names of the 7 districts and the number, boundaries and names of the wards into which each district is to be divided.

entry.title: The Maximum Number of Part-Time Sheriffs (Scotland) Order 2006
entry.summary: This Order amends section 11A(5) of the Sheriff Courts (Scotland) Act 1971 so as to raise the maximum number of part-time sheriffs at any one time from 60 to 80.
